concrete implementation of the abstract rewards contract must specify functions for accessing information about keeps and paying out rewards. For the purpose of rewards, Random Beacon signing groups count as \"keeps\" and the beacon operator contract acts as the \"factory\".","methods":{"allocateRewards(uint256)":{"details":"The given interval must be finished and unallocated. To allocate rewards correctly, any earlier intervals that are still unallocated will be allocated before the given interval. With reasonable interval lengths this should not pose a problem, and if allocating a later interval results in an out-of-gas issue, forcing the allocation of an earlier interval should fix it.","params":{"interval":"The interval to allocate."}},"eligibleButTerminated(bytes32)":{"params":{"_keep":"The keep to check."},"return":"True if the keep is terminated, false otherwise"},"eligibleForReward(bytes32)":{"details":"Keeps that close dishonorably or early are not eligible for rewards.","params":{"_keep":"The keep to check."},"return":"True if the keep is eligible, false otherwise"},"endOf(uint256)":{"details":"The end of an interval is exclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `endOf(i)` is in interval `i+1`.","params":{"interval":"The interval whose end is queried."},"return":"The end timestamp of the interval."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256)":{"details":"This function returns correct results for any allocated interval. Dividing the allocated rewards by the number of keeps in the interval will give the correct reward for a keep in the interval. However, if a keep in the interval is terminated its reward will be returned to the pool of unallocated tokens. This will not be reflected in the return value of this function.","params":{"interval":"A previously allocated interval."},"return":"The total number of tokens allocated for keeps in the interval."},"getIntervalCount()":{"return":"The number of explicitly specified intervals."},"getIntervalWeight(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"The percentage weight of the interval."},"initiateRewardsUpgrade(address)":{"params":{"_newRewardsContract":"The address of a new rewards contract."}},"intervalOf(uint256)":{"details":"If the timestamp is before `firstIntervalStart`, the interval is 0.","params":{"timestamp":"The timestamp whose interval is queried."},"return":"The interval of the timestamp."},"isAllocated(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Whether the interval has been allocated yet."},"isFinished(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Whether the interval is finished."},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"keepsInInterval(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Number of keeps created in the interval."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,bytes)":{"details":"Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating some intervals. If the contract has been upgraded, the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead. Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`. If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`, this collects them as well. The following invariant should hold right after calling this function: token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).","params":{"_from":"The original sender of the tokens. Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.","_token":"The token to fund the rewards in. Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.","_value":"The amount of tokens to fund."}},"receiveReward(bytes32)":{"params":{"keepIdentifier":"A unique identifier for the keep, e.g. address or number converted to a `bytes32`."}},"receiveRewards(bytes32[])":{"params":{"keepIdentifiers":"An array of keep identifiers."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"reportTermination(bytes32)":{"params":{"keepIdentifier":"The terminated keep."}},"reportTerminations(bytes32[])":{"params":{"keepIdentifiers":"An array of keep identifiers."}},"rewardClaimed(bytes32)":{"params":{"_keep":"The identifier of the keep."},"return":"True if rewards have been paid out for the keep, or its termination has been reported. False otherwise."},"startOf(uint256)":{"details":"The start of an interval is inclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `startOf(i)` is in interval `i`.","params":{"interval":"The interval whose start is queried."},"return":"The start timestamp of the interval."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}},"title":"KEEP Signer Subsidy Rewards"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"allocateRewards(uint256)":{"notice":"Allocate rewards for unallocated intervals up to and including the given interval."},"eligibleButTerminated(bytes32)":{"notice":"Checks if a keep is terminated and thus its rewards can be returned to the unallocated pool."},"eligibleForReward(bytes32)":{"notice":"Checks if a keep is eligible to receive rewards."},"endOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the timestamp corresponding to the end of the interval."},"finalizeRewardsUpgrade()":{"notice":"Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract. Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was initiated ended. Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are reported."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256)":{"notice":"Get the total amount of tokens allocated for all keeps in the specified interval."},"getIntervalCount()":{"notice":"Get the number of intervals with explicitly specified weights. All subsequent intervals will have an implicit weight of 100."},"getIntervalWeight(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the percentage of remaining unallocated rewards that is to be allocated to the specified interval."},"initiateRewardsUpgrade(address)":{"notice":"Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract."},"intervalOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the interval number the provided timestamp falls within."},"isAllocated(uint256)":{"notice":"Return whether the specified interval has been allocated."},"isFinished(uint256)":{"notice":"Return whether the given interval is finished."},"keepsInInterval(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the number of keeps created in the specified interval."},"receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Funds the rewards contract."},"receiveReward(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sends the reward for a keep to the keep members."},"receiveRewards(bytes32[])":{"notice":"Stakers can receive KEEP rewards from multiple keeps of their choice in one transaction to reduce total cost comparing to single calls for rewards. It is a caller responsibility to determine the cost and consumed gas when receiving rewards from multiple keeps."},"reportTermination(bytes32)":{"notice":"Report that the keep was terminated, and return its allocated rewards to the unallocated pool."},"reportTerminations(bytes32[])":{"notice":"Report about the terminated keeps in batch. All the allocated rewards in these keeps will be returned to the unallocated pool."},"rewardClaimed(bytes32)":{"notice":"Return whether the given keep has already claimed rewards or had its rewards reallocated due to termination."},"startOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the timestamp corresponding to the start of the interval."}},"notice":"A contract for distributing KEEP token rewards to keeps. When a reward contract is created, the creator defines a reward schedule consisting of one or more reward intervals and their interval weights, the length of reward intervals, and the quota of how many keeps must be created in an interval for the full reward for that interval to be paid out.  /// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract, and additional KEEP can be added at any time. The reward contract is funded with `approveAndCall` with no extra data, but it also collects any KEEP mistakenly sent to it in any other way.  /// An interval is defined by the timestamps [startOf, endOf); a keep created at the time `startOf(i)` belongs to interval `i` and one created at `endOf(i)` belongs to `i+1`.  /// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps created in the interval if the quota is not met.  /// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the interval.  /// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool, to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined schedule have a weight of 100%, meaning that all remaining unallocated rewards will be allocated to the interval.  /// Keeps of the appropriate type can receive rewards once the interval they were created in is over, and the keep has closed happily. There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for all keeps from the interval to close. Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.  /// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract. Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of unallocated rewards. "}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"@keep-network/keep-core/contracts/Rewards.sol":"Rewards"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"@keep-network/keep-core/contracts/KeepToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x42abcd9c9c67d8d83b91a01e42abde3355b3a67fb7c510d7d8b63b5e23d3defe","urls":["bzz-raw://ef26e4ad4042c74e230a343f9e69c2d142b581e4a2c7ee27ec51a1f7e9f91a68","dweb:/ipfs/QmfJ9cEpzj2WQ5upvizC16pthvC2vQP8geFeUATFb4ov2G"]},"@keep-network/keep-core/contracts/Rewards.sol":{"keccak256":"0x21dc64f9d1d2639bc4289de5c43e9c89b3e927fd11ade946da8615d888c7b022","urls":["bzz-raw://eebbff37974dfd4d547484f3bf00e345db707a1cd5d56c4cf5485302872e0d8f","dweb:/ipfs/QmVUXCDPNfx2ThEVKd2fZouZMUxxhsHGL6kkNdYRxuCcG8"]},"openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/math/Math.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4b5aa451e4e8801478708f94b118a7821c0500d676255eaf89fc78c14856ce4e","urls":["bzz-raw://bed15b3f35ed05505efc8fb5cb01d06c52230fbcaadf4ed24a85b1ac2f15f33c","dweb:/ipfs/QmS6tW81u8E4tvzVfVuqEuMCkdwAozQ6pKJPRBR4JEVmQp"]},"openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4ccf2d7b51873db1ccfd54ca2adae5eac3b184f9699911ed4490438419f1c690","urls":["bzz-raw://d62d769b2219d5de39013093412623e624fa887f871826ea3bae6052ee893610","dweb:/ipfs/QmV3yVktya1s617QmuzQR2CfuJgUi3dR2xEZY9ecmqZ2G1"]},"openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/ownership/Ownable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf79fb10e8235770eb4aea7249034076a3cc9f9119ad944fc48705bae9c9d20dc","urls":["bzz-raw://cd3429aa9a4878dcf6c73faa32c3722f4013d4be012ece543b246faa6b50f55c","dweb:/ipfs/QmS55hgTvNEAKinus19m65CB4wcymN8EiUPFpRx5tYJ1i2"]},"openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x852793a3c2f86d336a683b30d688ec3dcfc57451af5a2bf5975cda3b7191a901","urls":["bzz-raw://4f5b57664069671648fb81f55b0082faecdf1b2f159eec6b1fa6cef9b7d73bc5","dweb:/ipfs/QmcyytaLs7zFdb4Uu7C5PmQRhQdB3wA3fUdkV6mkYfdDFH"]},"openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20Burnable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa5ebf3344a36eb60e723e0764d85251c nodes.documentation:
@title KEEP Signer Subsidy Rewards
 @notice A contract for distributing KEEP token rewards to keeps.
 When a reward contract is created, the creator defines a reward schedule
 consisting of one or more reward intervals and their interval weights,
 the length of reward intervals, and the quota of how many keeps must be
 created in an interval for the full reward for that interval to be paid out.

/// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract,
 and additional KEEP can be added at any time.
 The reward contract is funded with `approveAndCall` with no extra data,
 but it also collects any KEEP mistakenly sent to it in any other way.

/// An interval is defined by the timestamps [startOf, endOf);
 a keep created at the time `startOf(i)` belongs to interval `i`
 and one created at `endOf(i)` belongs to `i+1`.

/// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining
 unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps
 created in the interval if the quota is not met.

/// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals
 the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is
 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the
 interval.

/// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool,
 to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined
 schedule have a weight of 100%, meaning that all remaining unallocated
 rewards will be allocated to the interval.

/// Keeps of the appropriate type can receive rewards once the interval they
 were created in is over, and the keep has closed happily.
 There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for
 all keeps from the interval to close.
 Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval
 the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.

/// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract.
 Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of
 unallocated rewards.

/// @dev A concrete implementation of the abstract rewards contract must specify
 functions for accessing information about keeps and paying out rewards.
 For the purpose of rewards, Random Beacon signing groups count as "keeps"
 and the beacon operator contract acts as the "factory".
nodes.name: Rewards

nodes.documentation:
@notice Funds the rewards contract.
 @dev Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and
 `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating
 some intervals.
 If the contract has been upgraded,
 the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead.
 Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval
 allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`.
 If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`,
 this collects them as well.
 The following invariant should hold right after calling this function:
 token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).
 @param _from The original sender of the tokens.
 Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.
 @param _value The amount of tokens to fund.
 @param _token The token to fund the rewards in.
 Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.
nodes.name: receiveApproval
receiveRewards
receiveReward

@notice Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract.
 @param _newRewardsContract The address of a new rewards contract.
nodes.name: initiateRewardsUpgrade

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Interval at which the upgrade was initiated hasn't ended yet"

nodes.documentation:
@notice Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract
 by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the
 not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract.
 Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was
 initiated ended.
 Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are
 reported.
nodes.name: finalizeRewardsUpgrade
_findEndpoint
_find
_getEndpoint
_getPreviousEndpoint
_baseAllocation

nodes.documentation:
@notice Calculate the reward allocation for an interval
 after adjusting for the number of keeps in the interval.
 @dev An interval with at least `minimumKeepsPerInterval` keeps
 will have the full reward allocated to it.
 An interval with fewer keeps will only be allocated a fraction of the
 base reward equaling the fraction of the quota that was met.
 The reward allocated for each keep in the interval is constant
 regardless of the number of keeps in the interval until the quota is
 met, and further increases in the number of keeps will lead to the same
 allocation being shared among more of them. Each keep in an interval is
 allocated the same reward. If the number of keeps in an interval meets
 the quota, but the base allocation isn't divisible by the number of
 keeps, the remainder will remain unallocated.
 Allocations for an already allocated interval, or when all prior
 intervals haven't been allocated yet, will produce incorrect results.
 @param interval The next interval to be allocated.
 @return The amount of tokens to allocate as rewards for the interval.
nodes.name: _adjustedAllocation
_processKeep
deallocate

 consisting of one or more reward intervals and their interval weights,
 the length of reward intervals, and the quota of how many keeps must be
 created in an interval for the full reward for that interval to be paid out.

/// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract,
 and additional KEEP can be added at any time.
 The reward contract is funded with `approveAndCall` with no extra data,
 but it also collects any KEEP mistakenly sent to it in any other way.

/// An interval is defined by the timestamps [startOf, endOf);
 a keep created at the time `startOf(i)` belongs to interval `i`
 and one created at `endOf(i)` belongs to `i+1`.

/// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining
 unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps
 created in the interval if the quota is not met.

/// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals
 the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is
 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the
 interval.

/// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool,
 to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined
 schedule have a weight of 100%, meaning that all remaining unallocated
 rewards will be allocated to the interval.

/// Keeps of the appropriate type can receive rewards once the interval they
 were created in is over, and the keep has closed happily.
 There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for
 all keeps from the interval to close.
 Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval
 the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.

/// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract.
 Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of
 unallocated rewards.

/// @dev A concrete implementation of the abstract rewards contract must specify
 functions for accessing information about keeps and paying out rewards.
 For the purpose of rewards, Random Beacon signing groups count as "keeps"
 and the beacon operator contract acts as the "factory".
attributes.name: Rewards

attributes.documentation:
@notice Funds the rewards contract.
 @dev Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and
 `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating
 some intervals.
 If the contract has been upgraded,
 the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead.
 Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval
 allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`.
 If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`,
 this collects them as well.
 The following invariant should hold right after calling this function:
 token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).
 @param _from The original sender of the tokens.
 Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.
 @param _value The amount of tokens to fund.
 @param _token The token to fund the rewards in.
 Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.

receiveRewards

reportTermination

attributes.documentation:
@notice Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract.
 @param _newRewardsContract The address of a new rewards contract.
attributes.name: initiateRewardsUpgrade

attributes.documentation:
@notice Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract
 by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the
 not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract.
 Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was
 initiated ended.
 Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are
 reported.
attributes.name: finalizeRewardsUpgrade

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Interval at which the upgrade was initiated hasn't ended yet"

attributes.type: literal_string "Interval at which the upgrade was initiated hasn't ended yet"
attributes.value: Interval at which the upgrade was initiated hasn't ended yet

attributes.name: _findEndpoint
_find
_getEndpoint
_getPreviousEndpoint
_baseAllocation

attributes.documentation:
@notice Calculate the reward allocation for an interval
 after adjusting for the number of keeps in the interval.
 @dev An interval with at least `minimumKeepsPerInterval` keeps
 will have the full reward allocated to it.
 An interval with fewer keeps will only be allocated a fraction of the
 base reward equaling the fraction of the quota that was met.
 The reward allocated for each keep in the interval is constant
 regardless of the number of keeps in the interval until the quota is
 met, and further increases in the number of keeps will lead to the same
 allocation being shared among more of them. Each keep in an interval is
 allocated the same reward. If the number of keeps in an interval meets
 the quota, but the base allocation isn't divisible by the number of
 keeps, the remainder will remain unallocated.
 Allocations for an already allocated interval, or when all prior
 intervals haven't been allocated yet, will produce incorrect results.
 @param interval The next interval to be allocated.
 @return The amount of tokens to allocate as rewards for the interval.
attributes.name: _adjustedAllocation
_processKeep
deallocate

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Contract has not been funded yet"

attributes.type: literal_string "Contract has not been funded yet"
attributes.value: Contract has not been funded yet

devdoc.details: A concrete implementation of the abstract rewards contract must specify functions for accessing information about keeps and paying out rewards. For the purpose of rewards, Random Beacon signing groups count as "keeps" and the beacon operator contract acts as the "factory".

allocateRewards(uint256).details: The given interval must be finished and unallocated. To allocate rewards correctly, any earlier intervals that are still unallocated will be allocated before the given interval. With reasonable interval lengths this should not pose a problem, and if allocating a later interval results in an out-of-gas issue, forcing the allocation of an earlier interval should fix it.

eligibleButTerminated(bytes32).return: True if the keep is terminated, false otherwise

eligibleForReward(bytes32).details: Keeps that close dishonorably or early are not eligible for rewards.
eligibleForReward(bytes32).return: True if the keep is eligible, false otherwise

endOf(uint256).details: The end of an interval is exclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `endOf(i)` is in interval `i+1`.

params.interval: The interval whose end is queried.

endOf(uint256).return: The end timestamp of the interval.

getAllocatedRewards(uint256).details: This function returns correct results for any allocated interval. Dividing the allocated rewards by the number of keeps in the interval will give the correct reward for a keep in the interval. However, if a keep in the interval is terminated its reward will be returned to the pool of unallocated tokens. This will not be reflected in the return value of this function.
getAllocatedRewards(uint256).return: The total number of tokens allocated for keeps in the interval.

getIntervalCount().return: The number of explicitly specified intervals.

getIntervalWeight(uint256).return: The percentage weight of the interval.

params._newRewardsContract: The address of a new rewards contract.

intervalOf(uint256).details: If the timestamp is before `firstIntervalStart`, the interval is 0.

params.timestamp: The timestamp whose interval is queried.

isAllocated(uint256).return: Whether the interval has been allocated yet.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

keepsInInterval(uint256).return: Number of keeps created in the interval.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,.details: Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating some intervals. If the contract has been upgraded, the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead. Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`. If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`, this collects them as well. The following invariant should hold right after calling this function: token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).

params._from: The original sender of the tokens. Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.
params._token: The token to fund the rewards in. Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.
params._value: The amount of tokens to fund.

params.keepIdentifier: A unique identifier for the keep, e.g. address or number converted to a `bytes32`.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

rewardClaimed(bytes32).return: True if rewards have been paid out for the keep, or its termination has been reported. False otherwise.

startOf(uint256).details: The start of an interval is inclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `startOf(i)` is in interval `i`.

params.interval: The interval whose start is queried.

startOf(uint256).return: The start timestamp of the interval.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: KEEP Signer Subsidy Rewards

allocateRewards(uint256).notice: Allocate rewards for unallocated intervals up to and including the given interval.

eligibleButTerminated(bytes32).notice: Checks if a keep is terminated and thus its rewards can be returned to the unallocated pool.

eligibleForReward(bytes32).notice: Checks if a keep is eligible to receive rewards.

endOf(uint256).notice: Return the timestamp corresponding to the end of the interval.

finalizeRewardsUpgrade().notice: Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract. Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was initiated ended. Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are reported.

getAllocatedRewards(uint256).notice: Get the total amount of tokens allocated for all keeps in the specified interval.

getIntervalCount().notice: Get the number of intervals with explicitly specified weights. All subsequent intervals will have an implicit weight of 100.

getIntervalWeight(uint256).notice: Return the percentage of remaining unallocated rewards that is to be allocated to the specified interval.

initiateRewardsUpgrade(address).notice: Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract.

intervalOf(uint256).notice: Return the interval number the provided timestamp falls within.

isAllocated(uint256).notice: Return whether the specified interval has been allocated.

isFinished(uint256).notice: Return whether the given interval is finished.

keepsInInterval(uint256).notice: Return the number of keeps created in the specified interval.

receiveReward(bytes32).notice: Sends the reward for a keep to the keep members.

receiveRewards(bytes32[]).notice: Stakers can receive KEEP rewards from multiple keeps of their choice in one transaction to reduce total cost comparing to single calls for rewards. It is a caller responsibility to determine the cost and consumed gas when receiving rewards from multiple keeps.

reportTermination(bytes32).notice: Report that the keep was terminated, and return its allocated rewards to the unallocated pool.

reportTerminations(bytes32[]).notice: Report about the terminated keeps in batch. All the allocated rewards in these keeps will be returned to the unallocated pool.

rewardClaimed(bytes32).notice: Return whether the given keep has already claimed rewards or had its rewards reallocated due to termination.

startOf(uint256).notice: Return the timestamp corresponding to the start of the interval.

userdoc.notice: A contract for distributing KEEP token rewards to keeps. When a reward contract is created, the creator defines a reward schedule consisting of one or more reward intervals and their interval weights, the length of reward intervals, and the quota of how many keeps must be created in an interval for the full reward for that interval to be paid out.  /// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract, and additional KEEP can be added at any time. The reward contract is funded with `approveAndCall` with no extra data, but it also collects any KEEP mistakenly sent to it in any other way.  /// An interval is defined by the timestamps [startOf, endOf); a keep created at the time `startOf(i)` belongs to interval `i` and one created at `endOf(i)` belongs to `i+1`.  /// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps created in the interval if the quota is not met.  /// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the interval.  /// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool, to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined schedule have a weight of 100%, meaning that all remaining unallocated rewards will be allocated to the interval.  /// Keeps of the appropriate type can receive rewards once the interval they were created in is over, and the keep has closed happily. There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for all keeps from the interval to close. Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.  /// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract. Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of unallocated rewards.
